alert.note: Alert for Upper Kobuk and Noatak Valleys (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Watch issued May 23 at 11:07AM AKDT by NWS Fairbanks
info.description: ...FLOOD WATCH FOR AN ICE JAM NOW IN EFFECT THROUGH WEDNESDAY AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding caused by an ice jam continues to be possible. * WHERE...Kobuk River near Ambler * WHEN...Through Wednesday afternoon. * IMPACTS...Impacts could range between localized high water or significant flooding. Now is the time to take precautions. Where possible, move items to higher ground and prepare your community for possible flooding. Flooding of fish camps and other remote cabins along this stretch of the Kobuk River is possible as well. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - As the breakup front moves downriver below Ambler, ice jams may form and release and result in flooding. An ice jam and flooding was observed on satellite imagery upriver from Ambler on Monday. When this jam releases, a surge of water and ice moving downriver could get hung up at in place ice downriver from Ambler. - Http://weather.gov/aprfc
info.instruction: You should monitor later forecasts and be alert for possible Flood Warnings. Those living in areas prone to flooding should be prepared to take action should flooding develop.
